channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Families are opening their hearts and homes to house the homeless and others in crisis
item.description:
August 02, 2020 7:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Two Singaporeans have started a movement to encourage and support families here to open their homes to provide a refuge for those facing a crisis, such as the homeless or abuse victims.

item.title: Shelters for the homeless have enough space: Ministry of Social and Family Development
item.description:
August 02, 2020 7:00 PM

SINGAPORE - There is sufficient space in the shelters for the homeless, which saw a surge of people seeking refuge during the two-months long circuit breaker period that ended on June 1.

item.title: NDP 2020: State flag to be flown across Singapore via 2 routes in east and west
item.description:
August 02, 2020 6:30 PM

For the first time, Singaporeans will be able to see from their homes the state flag fly-past during this year's National Day Parade (NDP).

item.title: NDP 2020: F-15 fighter jets to soar over hospitals, heartland in tribute to front-line, essential workers
item.description:
August 02, 2020 6:30 PM

The fighter jets will be performing the Roar Of Unity, a 30-minute long segment that will see the planes cover the island so that every Singaporean will be able to see and hear them from their homes.

item.title: Police unveil next-generation fast response car, which can detect wanted vehicles among other tech features
item.description:
August 02, 2020 6:00 PM

SINGAPORE - It only takes seconds for the Singapore Police Force's Ground Response Force (GRF) officers to detect vehicles of interest while driving in the latest fast response car.

item.title: High Court dismisses man's suit to have sisters, late mother's estate pay family business debt
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:52 PM

SINGAPORE - Two sisters were content to let "sleeping dogs lie" after they discovered that their brother had used funds from the family business for his own family's expenses.

item.title: 313 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 1 in the community and 5 imported
item.description:
August 02, 2020 3:41 PM

The community case is a permanent resident. The five imported cases had been placed on stay-home notices upon arrival in Singapore.

item.title: Istana opens virtual doors to the public for National Day
item.description:
August 02, 2020 3:16 PM

SINGAPORE - Guests of the first virtual National Day Istana Open House were treated to little nuggets of history on one of Singapore's oldest heritage sites on Sunday (Aug 2), with a "speaking" cheese plate as their host.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 2
NDP declared special event with enhanced security
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Day Parade (NDP) on Aug 9 has been declared an enhanced security special event, said the police yesterday.

item.description:

Despite being awarded damages of $445,000 against theÂ rider who crashed into his wife, there is little guarantee Mr Leong Loon Wah will actually get the money.

item.title: Sri Mariamman's chief priest arrested for CBT
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The police are investigating the chief priest of Singapore's oldest Hindu temple, the Sri Mariamman Temple, for an incident involving criminal breach of trust.

item.title: Training schemes aim to help workers get permanent jobs later
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Training and apprenticeship programmes offered as part of the SGUnited Jobs and Skills Package should translate into more career opportunities down the road, said Senior Minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Transport Chee Hong Tat.

item.title: Universities move freshmen orientation online amid Covid-19
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

University orientation season is here. Unlike in previous years, though, there are no loud, boisterous cheers or crowds of freshmen on campus grounds.

item.title: Singapore firms welcome foreign worker levy waiver, rebates but say they must restart work soon
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

For months since the start of the circuit breaker period in April, firms in the construction, marine shipyard and process sectors have had to halt all work.

item.title: App for reporting domestic violence on trial
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Domestic violence victims can soon receive aid quickly from social service agency Pave now that a new mobile app designed to help them is being tested.

item.title: Telemonitoring solutions for Covid-19 patients in community care facilities
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Covid-19 patients being cared for in community care facilities (CCFs) are getting their vital signs monitored round the clock using smart tracking kits that send their data remotely to doctors.

item.title: It Changed My Life: 'We are competitive, we play to win,' say gaming twins behind S'pore's biggest boutique PC builder
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

This is the second of a four-part Audemars Piguet series on rule breakers who thrive on challenges and boldly forge their own paths.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singaporean is sole community case, detected under enhanced testing
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A 26-year-old Singaporean woman was one of 307 new Covid-19 cases detected in Singapore as at noon yesterday, said the Health Ministry (MOH) in its daily update of coronavirus infections here.

item.title: Singapore-Malaysia border travel: What are the safety measures
DPM Heng Swee Keat thanks nurses for their service on Nurses' Day
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Taking the opportunity offered by Nurses' Day yesterday, Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat thanked nurses in Singapore for their service, especially amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Strict rules for Singapore, Malaysia border travel
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Applications for cross-border travel between Singapore and Malaysia for long-term pass holders and travellers on essential business and official visits will start on Aug 10.

item.title: Mobile column at NDP to cover record 200km, reach deeper into heartland
item.description:
August 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The mobile column, a drive-past of military vehicles and assets, will be scaled down for this year's National Day Parade (NDP), with 66 assets from the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF), Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) and Singapore Police Force (SPF) on display.
